Victory condition: You win if any one of the Insects survives by not getting caught by the Mushroom.

[How to Play]
---Starting the Round---
1. Insects hide under Ground sheets. (The Mushroom player counts numbers while holding the Ground cloth to conceal from their sight the view of the Insects hiding.)
2. The Mushroom player looks for the Insects.
3. Resolve the action (Flip the discovered Insects to turn them into Caterpillar Fungi, etc.).
---Ending the Round---
Steps 1 to 3 count as 1 round. Play 5 rounds.
After 5 rounds, proceed to the Result Announcement.
Ending the Game (Result Announcement and Ending)

—description from the designer

Name: Ngā Moana: Oceans
Description:
NGÄ€ MOANA | OCEANS is the first game in a series that follows the Peoples of the Pacific as they stride from the stone to the stellar age, in a rich Universe of OCEANS, ISLANDS, PEOPLES, WORLDS, STARS, and GODS.

OCEANS starts this epic story on a small Island home. Players play intrepid Characters from the Island who are preparing to venture into the middle of the vast Pacific Ocean, at the calling of their Ariki (Chief), following the tale of a navigator that returned from sea with stories of the Great Fish of Maui.

Players will play as a small whÄnau (family), within the story. They will work to build Waka Hourua (seafaring boats) and their whÄnau Mana, while following the Seasons and the Atua (Gods) that drive them. Players move three Meeples representing three generations of the whÄnau around an Island, collecting resources and building their technology.

The game uses an asynchronous game ending mechanic, meaning Players can finish earlier than others, but risk missing out on building bigger, and better Waka Hourua. Additionally, when playing as a game series, Players order of completion in OCEANS translates directly to the starting order of ISLANDS, providing a connected narrative between the games.

—description from the publisher

Name: DINO Sport
Description:
DINO Sport – is a game-race for all family, where a player wins a victory, if his dinosaur finished first. The participants of competition may need not only success but also smart performance for overcoming of obstacles, such as rivers, ripraps, bushes and barriers.


     wonderful for family leisure;
     easy and short rules, time of development — up to 5 minutes;
     interesting for both boys and girls (as well as for playing different children between themselves);
     ideal for beginners.


Winning a game
A player wins a victory, if his dinosaur finished first, running the established number of circles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Reign of Dice
Description:
Reign of Dice is played in the form of a team match.
4 or 6 players are the best.

Each team chooses one of the two camps. 
We select and control one of the heroes of each camp. 
There are 10 types more scenarios.
Depending on the scenario, you can play to free for all.

Select scenarios, camps and heroes. 
Each player receives 15 cards from the deck, of which five start-up hands are selected, and the rest are returned to the deck.

Each team takes turns. 
One round is ended when all players play one turn.

Each player's turn consists of four steps.


     Pulling out cards: Draw two cards from deck.
     Face 1: Choose whether to roll the dice. If you roll, must be as moved as the scale shown. If there is an enemy hero in the arrival compartment, take care of him immediately.
     Phase 2: Perform any of the following actions in the order you want them to:
         Use cards (However, multiple cards of the same color (type) cannot be used.)
         Use of hero capabilities (per hero, time and conditions of use vary and should be used accordingly.)
         Store use (the same store card cannot be used as a duplicate)
    
     Card Cleanup: If there are more than five pages of the handle, select and discard only five cards.


Winning conditions according to the scenario or
teams closer to winning conditions will win after the set round is over.

—description from the designer

Name: Traffic Oi!
Description:
Vietnam’s crazy traffic is made fun in this chaotic road race challenge where players try to be the first to drive across the country. Meander through busy streets and the countryside, while your opponents try to slow you down with flat tires, red lights and accidents. Start your Drive Pile, build up your kilometers, and look out for Bonus Cards and Safety Cards that can protect you from others. 104 cards with hilarious characters, and illustrated with some of Vietnam’s most famous cities and landmarks. As an extra design bonus, all the cards can be linked side by side to display one huge continuous scene.
English-French-Vietnamese language.
Inspired by Mille Bornes but with some twists.

Name: Exocracy
Description:
Strategy game, resource management and pits where your goal is to become a member of the Federation Z, a fanatical, extremist and strangely altruistic civilization dedicated to the conservation and exploration of the galaxy and the planets that form it. In this episode we must colonize the planet Azul 33A, which during the last stellar cycle suffered some kind of global disaster that has diminished the flora and fauna that inhabited it. You will have to restore the balance to the ecosystem, you will have to reforest forests and plains, repopulate the animal species and help the possible natives who have survived the hecatomb. If you think you are ready to restore your balance to the planet Blue 33A you can start your training as commander of the Z Federation.

The game is in full development, there have been several tests with great results and right now the rules are in the update phase, I hope to finish them in the coming weeks and update the profile of the game.

I encourage anyone to contact me with any questions about Exocracy or its development.

I am currently looking for an illustrator and a graphic designer to design the final image of the game, write me if you are interested.

—description from the designer

Name: Petrichor: Honeybee – The Swarming Promo Card
Description:
Promo card that was given for free as part of the Pocket Dragon Kickstarter-campaign.

Requires Petrichor: Honeybee expansion to play.

Setup: Place this card next to the play area, within reach of all players.

Gameplay: Any player may take a Swarming action, by discarding any one card. This can be first or second action, including after a player has passed. Each player (including the one who triggered Swarming) may then choose to gain 1 honey. For each player who chose to take honey, the triggering player may add one drop directly to the tile where the Bee is currently present. Afterwards, remove the Swarming card from play, it may not be triggered again in the game.

Name: [redacted]: The Transporter Room Promo Card
Description:
Promo card that was given for free as part of the Pocket Dragon Kickstarter-campaign.

Setup: Place this card next to the main board, as close to the Tunnel Entrance as possible. 
Gameplay: This is a new location, adjacent to the Tunnel Entrance (and to the Tunnel Exit, if playing with the Garden Party expansion). Its action is the Transporter: as an action move to any room, anywhere on the board. If that room is not empty, trigger Sneaking Out rules. Using the Transporter triggers the 
Computer Room’s ability, allowing the active player to be hacked (similarly, how using the Radio would).
The Transporter Room has no yellow border, therefore there are no interactions here when the lights are out.
For added thematic flair, say “One to beam down” every time you use the Transporter.

Name: Tash-Kalar: Arena of Legends – Love Elemental Promo Card
Description:
Promo card that was given for free as part of the Pocket Dragon Kickstarter-campaign.

Setup: Place this card next to the deck of legendary cards.

Gameplay: The Love Elemental can be summoned by discarding any legendary card while matching the pattern of the Love Elemental. Once summoned by either player, remove it from play. If the players would prefer to NOT know whether the Love Elemental is in play, it is alternatively recommended to pick (randomly or by agreement) one legendary card which is essentially replaced by Love Elemental. (Possible suggestion is the Fire Elemental, since it has similar pattern.) If so, the Love Elemental can only be played when a player discards the agreed upon legendary.

If playing with Open Legends variant, either add it as one of the three starting legendary cards, or agree upon one legendary to replace (see above), and when that card is revealed replace it with Love Elemental on the display.

Name: Pillow Fight
Description:
Game #8 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Single and Double Pillow hits, Single and Double Pillow bursts, Pillow Piles, Exploded Rooms, and Mom and Dad cards. After drawing a card, the player may hit other players with the Single or Double Pillow Hits; place a Pillow Pile in front of them to throw pillows in front of them rather than draw a card; take out a Pillow Pile with an Exploded Room; use Single or Double Pillow bursts to remove pillow hit(s), or place it in front of them to protect them from a pillow hit; skip someone by giving them a Mom and Dad card; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once all cards have been drawn and played or discarded, the player with the fewest remaining hits is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.

Name: Iconoclash
Description:
Iconoclash puts you center stage in the ultimate tabletop platform fighting action. You’ll join the fray as one of 11 characters, leverage clever card play to collect items, rushdown rivals, create powerful combos that launch them into the air and off the stage to outplay the competition. 'Iconoclash' captures the fast paced action and tactics of a platform fighter.   Choose your favorite character from a variety of board game universes. Each character has a unique deck and playstyle. Then select which map to fight on.

Each turn you’ll play two attacks, each with three different effects to choose from. Meaning that every character has over 500 unique attack combinations. Some attack options require you to spend a Power Token, giving them an added kick to deal massive damage. Attacks also send your opponents flying, potentially launching them off the edge of the board to deal extra damage. All the while, you will move across the stage to keep your opponent in range, dodge stage hazards, collect items, and avoid attacks. Reduce your opponent's HP to 0 to win.

Featuring three Multiplayer Modes for up to 4 players:
Classic Mode: Last one-standing wins. This mode is for players who love the classic no-holds-barred, last-one-standing action.
Battle Royale: The player to deal the most damage after 4 rounds wins. This mode is great for players who prefer game play that is about maximizing combos and want to avoid player elimination.
2 v 2: Team up with a partner for the win! This mode is perfect for 4-player action.

—description from the publisher

Name: Girl Genius: The Works – Kickstarter Funvelope Promo Cards
Description:
A set of four cards that were included in the Kickstarter exclusive Funvelope.

Includes:
Colette Voltaire: (4) Choose two cards with exactly one detail in common, and pop them both.
Doctor Lucky: (7) Replace this card with this card.
Queen Albia: (8) Choose one card from every player's Score Pile and shuffle them into the deck.
Doctor Rothfuss: (5) Swap up to three cards in your Score Pile with cards in another player's Score Pile.

Name: Grab the Mike, the "Worlds Greatest Karaoke Style" Board Game
Description:
You think you know music? You think you can recognize songs faster than your friends? Then prove it and Grab the Mike! The only game that tests your music knowledge, reaction time and singing ability (or lack thereof)! Cards are drawn to select music genres; whatever genre is revealed is then played on your favorite streaming radio app or played on your smart home speaker.  Once the song starts, the first person that recognizes the song Grabs the Mike and attempts to sing at least the first two lines of the song correctly. Know more than the first two lines? Then keep singing for more points.  The rest of the group judges you on how well you know the song and awards points accordingly. Or, use a pass chip and make any other player attempt said song. In the deck there are also spoiler cards, where you may have to sing a duet or the whole group may have to get up and sing as a choir. Fast-paced, addictive party game that is fun for all ages!

—description from the publisher

Name: Goo Nebula Panic
Description:
Escape from certain death in a nebula made of horrific goo monsters! In this game you become crewmembers lost in the Goo Nebula, attempting to repair a small ship before time runs out. Little handmade goo monsters of various colours and levels of deadliness seep on board: you must hunt through the junk on board to find the repair parts for your engine, then race to the bridge and warp to safety! Randomised ship layouts and a random deck of playing cards representing the stuff on board mean that each game is different, but always fun and challenging!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Grimm Forest: All Hallow's Eve Promo Card
Description:
The English version of this promo card was given out during PAX Unplugged 2018.

Card text:

When Revealed: Play on a Location (Stays in play until discarded.)

End of Gather Phase: Any player who is alone in this Location searches the deck for a Monster card and puts it in their hand.

Discard All Hallow's Eve if there are 3 or more Monsters in play at the end of the Gather Phase.

Name: Smok Wawelski
Description:
Smok Wawelski is a dexterity game for children (with a light tactical element) based on the Polish fable of the Wawel Dragon (in Polish: Smok Wawelski), one of the legendary stories that describes the beginnings of the Polish state.

The Wawel Dragon persecutes the castle of King Krak. Many brave warriors and the heroic knights are trying to dash out the terrifying beast, alas, with no result! A clever plan is needed for such a monster. Shoemaker Skub just came up with this one.

Place the cardboard dragon in the middle of the table, then place the cardboard knights on his tail. Now, the goal of the game is to tilt the figurine to the surface the game is played on. The model works like a two-arm lever. Under certain load on the head side it plummets to the table.

Go on and help the artful craftsman to implement his plan! On your turn:

1. Roll the dice.
2. The result of the roll allows you to take off one knight from the dragon’s tail or to put an artificial domestic animal (like cow or sheep stuffed with tar and sulfur) into the dragon’s mouth.
3. By adding or removing figurines, you attempt to plummet the dragon to the table. If you managed to do so, you win! You may imagine that the monster — like in the legend — begins to drink water from the Vistula river…
